reviews.text: Impossibly good vegan food.
I didn't know they meant vedge literally.
The ambiance, food and service were delicious, but it was not a complete 'wow' for me.
Every single aspect of this meal was perfect!
They know how to cook their seafood here.
Love the octopus, hate the small tables, love the spinach pie, hate the wait.
The space is very small and getting a table takes a bit of time.
It's BYOB so bring your favorite booze to pair with excellent Greek food.
This authentic Mexican restaurant and taqueria is everything you could ask for in a neighborhood taco joint.
Nice mom and pop Mexican eatery.
They unfortunately don't accept card for payment, but the food makes up for that.
Cash only but with the steep prices should take card.
You have to reserve your dough in advance!
This is & has been the best pizza in Philly for decades!
Tacconelli's is one of the most classic Philadelphia pizza joints. Their pizza is plain and simple, in the best way possible.
The sauce is on the sweeter side (not my taste but still very good) and the crust is thinner than your average pizza place and very crispy.
Absolutely delicious bagels! You won't be able to get their unique flavors (bagels and cream cheese!) elsewhere.
The bagels are DELICIOUS here, although slightly pricey for a bagel.
A word to the wise though, for those that like a softer kind of bagel this might not be up your alley, but I sill recommend giving it a try. The bagels here are on the harder side of the scale.
The employees are always super friendly, despite the insane lines I see on weekends. They keep the place cheerful and stress free.
Their indoor dining is SUPER TINY.
Vic's is my favorite sushi place in Philly!
Hole-in-the-wall, no frills, BUT delicious sushi for reasonable prices.
Good luck getting a seat! The place is tiny with just one table and some counter-seating.
This place is easily one of the best falafel spots in the city!
Tables turnover quickly enough, usually seated in 5 mins. It's small so it can get crowded.
I only wish they accept credit.  Crazy long lines during lunch.
Best falafel in Philadelphia.
This little place, hidden in a neighborhood, serves up some really great authentic Mexican food.
Overall I enjoyed eating here mostly cause it's hard not to love a burrito, ya know?
It wasn't the best  burrito I've ever had, but it definitely hit the spot.
If you live in South Philly or are in South Philly and aren't ordering from El Jarocho you're missing out.
I love Barbuzzo. Always have. The food is incredible, drinks are good and the Budino is legendary.
I'll be as direct as possible. The menu is out of this world but no matter what, GET THE BUDINO!
Barbuzzo was good, but I was a little underwhelmed considering the rave reviews.
Somehow every time I eat here the food ends up being too salty for my taste, especially the pizza. That being said, the pasta tastes very fresh and the house-made ricotta is a staple.
If you want authentic Japanese cuisine (including their hot dishes) there is simply no other place to consider, full stop.
I don't want to tell you about Sagami, because I want to keep it all to myself.
If you're looking for unique sushi rolls (e.g. any fried sushi rolls, extravagant plating, or different flavor combinations you've never heard of, etc.), this is NOT the place for you.
The menu is a little limited because they don't have sashimi or speciality sushi rolls, but it is still really good.
Best Italian hoagie I've ever had; hands down.  Owned by a husband and wife couple who share a passion for quality ingredients and service.
Castellino's has become my go-to spot for everything. It's the most convenient, yet most delicious and high quality little corner shop in the area.
I think the hoagie was made with care and attention, but was disappointed in the expediency here.
They pack a lot of quality into a tiny corner store.
Very unassuming, but this place is one of the top Indian food places in Philly.
Overall, it's a good spot, just needs to be more consistent with its staples.
When it comes to authentic Indian food, look no further than Ekta.
Eating in is different, however I've given up on the exorbitant prices for takeout.
Still my go to place for authentic New Orleans po-boys.
A small neighborhood bar that actually serves authentic Cajun food!
I LOVE that there's vegan options.
Best creole food and drinks outside of NOLA.
It's always a treat to get a table at Zeppoli--one of my favorite Italian restaurants.
Gets crowded. Go Monday or mid-week if you can. Reservations a must.
Some hits, some misses, but overall a 3.5ish if ya ask me.
One of the BEST restaurants in Philadelphia Delaware Valley.
I was not about to come to Philly and not have a cheesesteak and since I'm vegetarian this was the perfect spot!
This is a hole in the wall off of Broad - the missing star is just due to the lack of ambiance and charm. It's sort of grungy in here (although it didn't feel dirty).
When in Philly, eat a cheesesteak, they say. Well what if you're a vegan or vegetarian. Then go to Govinda's!
Worth the wait but the service is extremely slow and the food takes FOREVERRR.
the best
